text: this is Seth my dad's reporting from
Hanoi he's the last blacksmith on
blacksmith Street bent over his tiny
roaring Forge in the heart of Hanoi
I still remember when it was raining
lightly the streets were empty that was
all you could hear Kakaako cook the
sound of the hammers it created a
special atmosphere for blacksmiths the
city is famous for its 36 streets the
narrow lanes in its ancient Quarter
named for the trades that once did
business here my father told me to come
back to work as a blacksmith because
that is the name of the street he said I
was born here you were too we carry the
name of the blacksmith's but there are
no more fan makers on fan Street no more
sweet potato vendors on sweet potato
Street the smithee's on blacksmith
Street have been replaced by modern
big-city Commerce and the blacksmith's
are all but gone from Vietnam only
windfall hung is left here sweating in
his Street side niche as if nothing had
changed
and he knows he is the last this work
will be gone there will be no more
blacksmiths on blacksmiths Street since
he took over the business from his
father 17 years ago mr. who opens his
shop at 7:00 a.m.
and works in the heat and roar of the
city until sunset there are still
customers for his handmade drill bits
crowbars hammer heads and other tools I
worry about him stopping there's no one
to replace him he wants to train
somebody but nobody wants to follow him
we invent folk is a historian who's
documented the changing street scene in
Hanoi we got you to Michael the old
generation remembers the past and maybe
the younger generation does not I'm an
old man I feel sad to see us lose these
ancient streets mr. Hong is proud of his
chosen trade is provided a good living
for his family
my father was proud of being a
blacksmith he could take care of his
family and now I can take care of my
family with this Forge and when one day
he closes up his little sidewalk smithy
blacksmith Street will be only a name
I'm proud that I'm the last one this
work is very difficult to learn this
work will be gone
nobody will follow me nobody in my
family and nobody in society
